alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Brown; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Rock, northeastern Brown, eastern Keya Paha and northwestern Boyd Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 815 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Springview, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Naper, Burton, Nets Peak, Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Mariaville, Pine Glen State Wildlife Refuge, Mills and Brocksburg. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 204 and 212. Highway 12 between mile markers 60 and 103. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
